intro: Clidemia ossaeoides, commonly known as the Hawaiian stinging nettle, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and stream banks. Clidemia ossaeoides is also known for its stinging hairs, which can cause irritation upon contact with the skin.
